Win rate is perhaps the most inaccurate thing to judge a champion's effectiveness. You might as well as be saying "Master Yi is green so he's doing poor, I think if he was red he'd be doing a lot better."
Win rate works as a metric when it is in the extremes: extremely high win rate, and extremely low win rate. When things are that far off from the median, then it suggests something isn't right.

That coupled with the general consensus of a champion's skill floor/skill ceiling. 

If a champion has a high skill floor and ceiling and they have a low win rate, it makes sense. 

Yi is generally agreed to be a low skill floor and high skill ceiling champion, if he, as a low skill floor champion is sitting at 42% then there's something definitely wrong with him.
